description: From Middle English forsothe, forsoþe, for sothe, from Old English for sōþ (“truly, for certain, forsooth”), equivalent to for (“for, by”) +‎ sooth (“truth”).

entries.meaning: (archaic or poetic) Used as an intensifier, often ironic: indeed, really, truthfully.
examples: Synonyms: in point of fact, in truth, to tell the truth; see also Thesaurus:actually
